name: Gekitotsu Dangan Jid?sha Kessen: Battle Mobile
description:
One year ago they took from you your wife. Now it's time to pay them back, with interest.

Gekitotsu Dangan Jid?sha Kessen: Battle Mobile plays similarly to Spy Hunter in both perspective and objective, but your car in Battle Mobile isn't quite as high tech an instrument as that other game's vehicle. You can launch unlimited missiles, but they can only hit helicopters. For ground based targets you must dash into them to ram them off the road. Your car's health is constantly dwindling, even when you're not being attacked by enemies, so picking up the occasionally appearing energy refill items is essential. Shields can be picked up and stored that will make your car invulnerable to all damage for a short while.

shot.caption: I can't imagine what could spoil this wonderful moment.
Why can't quests for revenge ever have happy beginnings?

These tankers drop oil slicks.
We're fairly high up, aren't we?
This helicopter boss drops napalm on the road, and like smaller copters can only be hit with missiles.
A brief visit to the city...
...followed by a dangerous trip on icy roads.
The renegades apparently have a B-2 bomber at their disposal.
Boss#3 attacks with missile strikes.
A peaceful drive by the ocean ruined by litterers.
This stage's boss starts off with a series of turrets mounted on train cars.
The train will leap the tracks at the end of the fight and shove you into the edges of the screen with a steam attack.
Your adversaries have converted all sorts of construction vehicles into weapons.
